title: Kylie Minogue looks chic in a silk jumpsuit as she arrive at her luxury hotel
text:
She recently chartered a $36 million gold helicopter across England after performing at the Glastenbury music festival.

And Kylie Minogue, 51, enjoyed another lavish commute Wednesday as she touched down in a chopper outside Crown Towers hotel in Perth.

The pop princess looked impossibly glamorous as she disembarked the helicopter in a silk printed jumpsuit with long sleeves.

Spinning around! Kylie Minogue, 51, looked chic in a silk jumpsuit as she arrived at Crown Towers hotel via private helicopter during a low-key Perth getaway on Wednesday

The petite songstress also clutched her mobile phone and a pair of spectacles in one hand.

Completing her distinctly 70s-inspired look, Kylie parted her hair in the centre and allowed her blonde locks to hang in textured curls.

Kylie was all smiles as she made her way towards the hotel with her entourage, as one suited assistant dutifully shielded her from the elements with an umbrella.

VIP arrival! Kylie was all smiles as she made her way towards the hotel with her entourage, as one suited assistant dutifully shielded her from the elements with an umbrella

The sighting comes after Kylie was named the GQ Icon of the Year at the GQ Men of the Year Awards 2019.

The singer is loved-up with her boyfriend Paul Solomon, who is the GQ creative director, and talked to the publication after her win about her future and admitted that she 'never really plans'.

She said: 'I never really plan, there's no ﬁve, ten-year master strategy, but I always think, ''I wonder what's round the corner?'' Maybe I'll just take a peek.'

'I never really plan, there's no ﬁve, ten-year master strategy': Kylie recently told GQ magazine about her future and admitted that she 'never really plans'

Kylie also spoke about why it took her so long to earn the credit that she deserves after four decades in the music industry.

She said: 'Tall Poppy Syndrome. I have copped that always, forever. I had to learn about that really early on.'

The star has sold more than 80 million albums worldwide, and her music boasts over half a billion streams globally on Spotify alone.
description: She recently chartered a $36 million gold helicopter across England after performing at the Glastenbury music festival.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
